UnitDefinition.Name: Substance group selection method types
UnitDefinition.Description: Accepted Substance group selection method types.

Unit.Name: All substances
Unit.Description: Include all substances of the substances table and use hazard characterisation imputation for missing hazard data.

Unit.Name: Restrict to available hazard data
Unit.Description: Restrict to the substances with available hazard data (either in the form of dose response models or RPFs).

Unit.Name: Restrict to available hazard data and possible membership
Unit.Description: Consider only the substances with available hazard data and non-zero membership (i.e., P(AG) > 0).

Unit.Name: Restrict to available hazard data and certain membership
Unit.Description: Consider only substances with certain assessment group membership (i.e., P(AG) = 1) and for which a hazard characterisation is available.

Unit.Name: Restrict to non-zero membership
Unit.Description: Consider all substances, use TTC based on the Cramer class for the substances for which no limit dose or RPF is defined.

Unit.Name: Restrict to certain membership
Unit.Description: Consider only the substances with certain assessment group membership (i.e., P(AG) = 1).
